description: From 1831, "official signature or endorsement on a passport," from French visa, from Latin charta vīsa (“paper that has been seen”) from feminine perfect passive of Latin vidēre (“to see”).

entries.meaning: A permit to enter and leave a country, normally issued by the authorities of the country to be visited.
examples: I came on a six-month tourist visa.

verbs.description: visa (third-person singular simple present visas, present participle visaing, simple past and past participle visaed)
